name: Anand Padmanabha Iyer
content: Anand Iyer anand.iyer@gatech.edu KACB 3332 I am a tenure-track Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at Georgia Institute of Technology where I lead the NEXS group. My research interests are broadly in the systems and networking space, with a current focus on systems that span the cloud, the network, and the edge in enabling efficient data analysis and machine learning. I am always looking for highly motivated PhD and Masters students to join my group. If you are interested in working with me and like building systems, please apply to Georgia Tech's CS PhD program or MS program and mention my name. If you are a Georgia Tech student, please get in touch with me. Before coming to Georgia Tech, I was a researcher at Microsoft Research. I completed my PhD in Computer Science at the University of California, Berkeley advised by Ion Stoica. Previously, I worked with the Mobility, Networks & Systems group at Microsoft Research India. I completed my Masters degree in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Austin advised by Lili Qiu. My undergraduate degree is from College of Engineering, Trivandrum. Students I am fortunate to work with these excellent students: Mingyu Guan (co-advised with Prof. Taesoo Kim) Vima Gupta Mursalin Kabir Rishat Uma Anand Alumni Kartik Sinha (MS 2024 → Citadel) Swapnil Gandhi (Research Fellow → PhD student at Stanford University) Teaching I am teaching (or have taught) these courses: CS 8803 - Systems for AI: Spring 2024, Fall 2025 CS 6210/4210 - Advanced Operating Systems: Spring 2025, Spring 2026 CS 3210 - Design of Operating Systems: Fall 2023, Fall 2024 Service I have served (or am currently serving) on the program committee of the following conferences: USENIX ATC: 2022, 2023, 2024 USENIX NSDI: 2023, 2025, 2026 USENIX OSDI: 2024, 2025, 2026 ACM ASPLOS: 2026 ACM EuroSys: 2026 ACM SoCC: 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 ACM SOSP: 2025
